solution_line_template: First find the cost per member of the hardcover books: ${hardcover_price}/book * {num_hardcover} books = $<<{hardcover_price}*{num_hardcover}={hardcover_total}>>{hardcover_total}.
Then find the cost per member of the paperback books: ${paperback_price}/book * {num_paperback} books = $<<{paperback_price}*{num_paperback}={paperback_total}>>{paperback_total}.
Then find the total cost per member: ${hardcover_total} + ${paperback_total} + ${annual_fee} = $<<{hardcover_total}+{paperback_total}+{annual_fee}={total_per_member}>>{total_per_member}/member.

Now find the total amount of money by multiplying the cost per member by the number of members: ${total_per_member}/member * {num_members} members = $<<{total_per_member}*{num_members}={total_collected}>>{total_collected}.
